channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Weak Bridge, 23rd June
item.description:
The bridge is located on Brockhampton Lane, Cheltenham, GL51 9RS. I have large concerns over a small bridge that goes over the stream. There have been large lorries going over the bridge. I believe there should be a weight restriction in place and signage around.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Brockhampton Lane, Kingsditch, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Sign plate is missing (Non illuminating sign)

item.title: Dog poo warden warning missing, 23rd June
item.description:
We had some signs warning of a dog poo warden patrolling on Old Pates' field - please can we have these back? They were effective in making people clean up their dog mess.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Pilford Avenue, Naunton, Cheltenham

item.title: Several overhanging trees in Hatherley Road between Warden Hill Road and Belworth Drive are too low. Double deckers buses can not gain access to bus stop without making contact and have to move towards the middle of the road when travellling in a westerley direction., 23rd June
item.description:
The bus stop that can not be accessed safely is named "Warden Hill Road" and has the naptan code glodpmjm. The what3 words location is violin.took.august

item.category: General road markings, lines and stud issues

item.title: General road markings, lines and stud issues problem, 23rd June
item.description:
Please see attached e-mail from a resident living in Oakdene, which is in the corner of Hatherley and Lansdown Road in Cheltenham. They are complaining about the "KEEP CLEAR " road markings at the entrance to Block of flats @ Hatherley Court & Oakdene which need repainting, as they are nearly obliterated. I can testify to this being dangerous myself, as I had to exit from their carpark onto Hatherley Road myself, this morning. The "KEEP CLEAR " road markings at the entrance to Block of flats @ Hatherley Court & Oakdene need repainting, as they are nearly obliterated. We have already had one accident as a result of one of the drivers not seeing the markings.
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: General road markings, lines and stud issues

item.title: Tree is damaged problem, 23rd June
item.description:
A resident has approached me about this tree on Winchester Way, which she believes was part of a GCC tree planting scheme a couple of years ago. She has mentioned that the tree is no longer secured and could fall over/snap. She has tried to secure it temporarily with some string btw. Do you have someone who can a closer look and see what they can do?
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree cutter rude, 23rd June
item.description:
No signs in road or on opposite side of pavement didn't know they was doing work as I crossed the road and once I noticed the sign on the opposite side of the road hidden behind the workers van I apologised, and he said, can't you f****** read? Can't you see, do you not have eyes? And I said, no I couldn't see it, because the sign was behind the Van, out of sight. And he said you're on camera and I said thats ok coz im reporting u for due care n safety I do not appreciate being abused verbally for their mistake and mishap

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, Brooklyn Road, St Mark's, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Tree causing damage/obstruction to pavement or road

item.title: Traffic taking unacceptable amount of time to exit Nine Elms road onto Chelt Rd., 23rd June
item.description:
Again and again The traffic lights from Nine Elms to Cheltenham Rd is giving approx 7seconds for ONE CAR to exit Nine Elms onto Chelt Rd. however it gives the traffic on Chelt Rd about 30seconds. It took my husband 38minutes to exit Nine Elms thismorning and my kids are late for school and my daughter late for an exam. Before the roadworks for the cycle path changed the lights at this crossroads, the timing was fine. Why has it been changed?? This has only been an issue since the lights have been replaced. Please set them back to the original settings. Absolutely frustrating.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, Nine Elms Road, Elmbridge, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet
